alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 5:14PM EDT until July 21 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN HARTFORD COUNTY... At 514 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing flooding on several streets in East Hartford, including Brewer Street. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Excessive rain has since ended, although additional thunderstorms developing in northern New Haven and southern Litchfield Counties may bring another period of heavy rains to the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring and more instances of flooding may develop as additional storms move into the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Sharp rises on creeks and streams in the warned area over bankfull. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, East Hartford, Southington, Glastonbury, Newington, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill, Avon, Plainville and Burlington. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
